Actions Former Beneficiaries Must Take Before VA Will Reconsider Awarding Benefits
VA will reconsider awarding benefits to a former beneficiary whose award VA discontinued under the provisions of
38 CFR 3.653(a)
if the former beneficiary
files a supplemental claim, and
submits credible evidence showing he/she is not guilty of mutiny, treason, sabotage, or rendering assistance to the enemy.
The effective date of an award of benefits under the provisions of this block may be no earlier than the date VA received the supplemental claim.
